outcomes.title: Line Slopes
outcomes.description: Identify the slope of a line from its equation

exercises.pretext:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. -2 \, x + y = 7
  2. y = -3 \, x - 4
  1. \frac{1}{2}
  2. -3
exercises.html:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(-2 \, x + y = 7\)
  2. \(y = -3 \, x - 4\)

Answer:

  1. \(\frac{1}{2}\)
  2. \(-3\)

exercises.pretext:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. -6 \, x + 7 \, y = \left(-8\right)
  2. y = -7 \, x - 5
  1. \frac{7}{6}
  2. -7
exercises.html:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(-6 \, x + 7 \, y = \left(-8\right)\)
  2. \(y = -7 \, x - 5\)

Answer:

  1. \(\frac{7}{6}\)
  2. \(-7\)

exercises.pretext:

exercises.html:

  2. \(-8 \, x + 3 \, y = 0\)

Answer:

  1. \(3\)

  1. \(2 \, x + 3 \, y = \left(-6\right)\)
  2. \(y = -5 \, x + 1\)

  2. \(-5\)

outcomes.title: Product Rule
outcomes.description: Apply the product rule to take derivatives

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=-4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) f'(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} - 4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)\]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} - 4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)\]

exercises.pretext:

\[ f(x)=-3 \, x^{8} \log\left(x\right)\]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-24 \, x^{7} \log\left(x\right) - 3 \, x^{7}\]

f(x)=3 \, \cos\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right) f'(x)=3 \, \cos\left(x\right)^{2} - 3 \, \sin\left(x\right)^{2}
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=3 \, \cos\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right)\]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=3 \, \cos\left(x\right)^{2} - 3 \, \sin\left(x\right)^{2}\]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=2 \, x^{2} \sin\left(x\right) f'(x)=2 \, x^{2} \cos\left(x\right) + 4 \, x \sin\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=2 \, x^{2} \sin\left(x\right)\]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=2 \, x^{2} \cos\left(x\right) + 4 \, x \sin\left(x\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=-2 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} f'(x)=-2 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 2 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-2 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x}\]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-2 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 2 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)\]

\[ f(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right)\]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right)^{2} + 4 \, \sin\left(x\right)^{2}\]
